comment: The class was very boring for me. Her class was very lecture heavy and she was monotone all the way through. I didn't even open the book. All quiz and test questions can be googled and they are all taken online.

Although she is a very nice lady, I found her class to be very textbook and lecture heavy. Most of the lectures were litterally straight from thr book. For those whom know music already I was often bored in the class and would just go back and read the chapters in my own time.

While she does seem passionate about the material she lacks the ability to make that material appealing to others. Her boring lectures made me want to fall asleep on many occasions. It's not a hard class as long as you study for the listening portions and do her study guides. You don't even have to pay attention to her lectures.

I will say she is a very boring teacher. She does discussion  posts for attendance online, so you can skip and still do well. Just remember to do them. She is very sweet, however if you don't have any musical background the class can be seen as difficult.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She's such a good teacher and cares about what she does and knows what she's talking about, just make sure you show up to class and pay attention. For tests and quizzes she makes study guides that has pretty much all the content you need and one time she even read off questions from the test!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's not the best teacher, her lectures are rather boring. Her tests, on the other hand, are pretty easy, but there is a listening section so you need to be able to identify the songs. For the most part you can skip class and just read from the book/powerpoints and be perfectly fine. She says she takes attendance but she never took it
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You have to attend 3 concerts (2 at KSU, 1 at Atlanta Symphony) and provide proof of going. You then have to write a 2 page essay about your experience. She has 2 tests and 1 quiz. The quiz was super easy, but the tests were awful. Her final is group project on whatever artist you choose with whoever you choose. She's very monotone but nice

Dr. Akerman is a very sweet lady but she has such a boring monotone voice it is hard to stay awake. She spends a lot of time on little things to make sure people understand. If you dont know anything about music then DO NOT take her. If you know about music and the technicals then the hard part is keeping your eyes open. Long lectures, difficult
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I don't know why Professor Akerman has such a bad reputation. I took Music in Society because I was in orchestra for 7 years, so this class was a breeze for me. I get it, if you don't have any background then you're kind of screwed. I knew what she was talking about, the class was insightful and she was a real sweet person. I would recommend her!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Not very entertaining, reads power points from the power point. Have to attend 3 concerts and write papers about them, not very difficult. Group project at the end of semester. Tests are very difficult. Boring class, but she doesn't take attendance everyday.

I took Professor Ackerman for Music In Society and it had to be the most boring class I have ever taken at KSU. She rambles on the entire class period and doesn't speak with any enthusiasm. I think her lack of enthusiasm is what made this class so tough. Most of the students went to sleep even if they were failing. I got an A but it sucked!

Akerman was very dry and her lectures were long. I almost fell asleep a couple of times. Her tests are hard if you don't read the book and listen to the songs she give you. Make sure you study before the test because the material is not common sense if you aren't into music. She is very passionate about music so she knows what she is talking about.

I have been involved in music for several years, so this was an easy B for me (I skipped a lot, so I should have gotten an A). Dr. Ackerman is so sweet and makes lectures super interesting!  A little monotoned at times, but otherwise a great professor! Her tests are clear and she gives study notes. I would love to take her class again!

she is a nice lady, but her teaching style just doesn't work. Long, pointless lectures everyday. No one pays attention and just does homework for other classes. I just taught myself everything on review days and took the test. Lectures are completely pointless!
She teaches straight out the book. Not hard, but studying is necessary.
I love music, but I really didn't get anything out of Dr. Akerman's lectures. I easily aced all the tests because I have 10+ years of music experience, but she is very boring. I don't recommend her.

This class was very difficult for me. I am not a music major and took this my first semester. I had all As in all my classes and ended up with a C in here. The lectures were very long and boring, and I could not get a B or above on a test no matter how hard I studied. I recommend choosing another class to fill your arts requirement.

She has experience with music, but as a teacher, she is not recommended. Her classroom lectures unclear and ineffective. She required an unnecessary 1-2 page paper for the 3 music concerts we have to attend.  She needs to understand that Music 1107 is just a required general education course that has little or no relevance to any non-music major.

One of the worst teachers ever because she does not teach. She reads you some of the text and plays a few listening examples. Thats her lectures, and then test are crazy hard even if you study a bunch. You dont learn. Do not take this glass if you want to keep a gpa. There is muchhhhh better teachers for music! This leaves people hating music.
Not very clear. Monotone. Would not recommend.

She doesn't have any clue how to be prepared for class. She just rambles on and on. If you have some basic knowledge of music and you can read a textbook you should be fine. Also show up on review days for tests and that will help a little bit. Overall she was boring and just used the book. There's no reason to go to class besides tests and review

For the most part, this class is an easy A. Just make sure you show up on the review day before a test and you should be fine. She hardly ever takes roll. The only part I didn't like was having to attend three concerts and write about them.

VERY difficult class if you have no/weak prior knowledge of music theory. She seemed like she wasn't sure what to do when she was up in front of the class. She doesn't give clear answers to questions and ALWAYS showed up at least 10 minutes late. I took music all through high school and still struggled with this class. Din't recommend.
Not helpful. Had I not gone into the class with a general understanding of how to play guitar, I would have failed. Does not teach, just states what you do wrong and expects you to fix it.
Most boring professor I have ever had. She just talks forever in monotone. Don't take if you zone out easily. You will learn nothing.

This class is really boring. She just drones on and on the entire time. I usually check in and leave. It isn't too hard of a class though. Go to the concerts, do well on the group project and you should be fine. She puts up study guides for each test. Don't really like her, but the class itself isn't too awful.

Buy the book online. Follow along with her. Her tests are straight from the book. If you are lost, ask questions. She assumes you know about music, especially if you don't ask. Going to concerts is annoying, but as long as you can make it to the Altanta Symphony, you shouldn't have trouble.

This class is pretty easy. The only annoying thing is having to attend two concerts at KSU and one Atlanta symphony concert and writing papers on them. Other than that, It's a pretty easy class. I would recommend, Prof. Akerman really enjoys her music!
